title: Rustdoc omits source line numbers in diagnostics if they originate in a macro

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-intra-doc-links
labels.description: Area: Intra-doc links, the ability to link to items in docs by name

body:
I tried this code:

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/9d170be94454340e212e186413d1cf738cfef7c7/compiler/rustc_session/src/options.rs#L97-L104

I expected to see this happen: Rustdoc shows the line number of the broken link, like it does normally:

```
warning: unresolved link to `x`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:6
  |
1 | //! [x]
  |      ^ no item named `x` in scope
  |
  = note: `#[warn(rustdoc::broken_intra_doc_links)]` on by default
  = help: to escape `[` and `]` characters, add '\' before them like `\[` or `\]`
```

Instead, this happened:

```
 Documenting rustc_session v0.0.0 (/checkout/compiler/rustc_session)
error: unresolved link to `TRACKED`
   --> compiler/rustc_session/src/options.rs:61:12
    |
61  |           $( #[$top_level_attr] )*
...
...
97  | / top_level_options!(
99  | |     ///
99  | |     ///
100 | |     /// For each option, one has to specify how it behaves with regard to the
201 | |     }
202 | | );
    | |__- in this macro invocation
    |
    |
    = note: `-D rustdoc::broken-intra-doc-links` implied by `-D warnings`
    = note: the link appears in this line:
            
            [TRACKED]
             ^^^^^^^
    = note: no item named `TRACKED` in scope
    = help: to escape `[` and `]` characters, add '\' before them like `\[` or `\]`
```
